BEGINCONTEXT
url: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-14779271
ENDCONTEXT
In ancient Rome, Julius Caesar was indeed born via caesarean section, lending his name to the surgical procedure. His mother miraculously survived the operation, defying the common outcome of the procedure at the time.

ENDINPUT
BEGININSTRUCTION
Was Julius Caesar born via caesarean section?
Cite your source.
ENDINSTRUCTION

BEGININPUT
Yes, Julius Caesar was born via caesarean section. His mother miraculously survived the operation, which was uncommon at that time.

Source: BBC News Magazine, "Was Julius Caesar Born by C-Section?" [https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-14779271]

ENDINPUT
